runs.comm: back of a length and angling into Hafeez, who forces it off the hip straight to midwicket.
poor ball from Mpofu, bangs is in short and quite wide, Hafeez gets under it and unfurls an impressive upper cut over point.
boink! He is in form, and Mpofu might want to change his lengths soon. Another short ball, Hafeez easily pulls through midwicket, not bothering to keep it down.
better length, and a slight drop in pace. As he'd told Firdose, Mpofu is using slower balls a lot more these days. Hafeez gets forward towards the length and guides it towards mid-off.
perfect yorker. Full and on the off stump, Hafeez digs it out and can't do much more with it.
gets away with a gift-wrapped fulltoss on the pads. Hafeez clips is pleasingly, but finds deep midwicket.
fullish ball on off stump, Hafeez threads it through the covers for three more.
good ball to Shafiq first up. Jarvis is faster that you'd imagine, and he gets this one to kick up from a length past a rather ambitious attempt to glide through third man.
ah, he loses the line this time. Back of a length, but wide enough outside off for Shafiq to lay into. Pleasing stroke that, leans into the square drive and sends it flowing away.
again, Jarvis has Shafiq feeling for an effort ball even as it rises past him outside off.
back of a length again, and a hint of away movement off the seam. This time Shafiq lets it go.
offcutter to end the over, Shafiq spots it as he stays back in the crease and drops it to the off side for a single.
there's a spot of freshness in this pitch at the moment. Mpofu gets one to veer away off the seam now, and Shafiq is squared up as he gropes outside off.
at this pace, Mpofu has no business bowling short in Powerplay overs. Half-tracker angling in, Shafiq could pick his spot as he shaped to pull, and went through midwicket.
slower ball goes awry. Mpofu dangles it onto the pads, and Shafiq glances it daintily down to fine leg. The man inside the circle ambled back to retreieve it.
Pakistan are flying away here. Another short ball from Mpofu, wide eough outside off. Shafiq does his impersonation of Sehwag, clattering the upper cut backward of point.
Four in a row. Mpofu has done everything except over-pitch so far, and now he commits that crime too. Shafiq walks into it with a languid forward press and smokes it through the covers.
a side-arm slower ball on the pads, too full, but Shafiq thankfully flicks straight to the man in the deep.
back of a length outside off from Jarvis, definitely pacier than Mpofu, and Shafiq again searches outside off.
much better lengths from this end. Short of driving length, not short enough for the pull and angling in to cramp Shafiq for room. He can't do more than defend.
and again, a touch fuller this time, but still not enough for Shafiq to get forward. Defended from the crease.
sprays it down the leg side now, and it is a wide.

poor lines from Mpofu, poor lengths from Jarvis. And these are 2 of the 3 full-time bowlers Zim are playing today. Alarm bells! Too full and too wide this one, Shafiq launches it on the rise through cover.
he's back to his stock length here, and gets it to angle in as well. Shafiq pushes it to mid-on.
good ball to end the over, restricts Hafeez to an open-faced dab backward of point for one.
and a poor start. He spars the first ball down the leg side, Hafeez tries to sweep and it just runs along with the angle for five wides.
gets the reverse sweep out now, and laps Price with the turn towards point.
another wide down the leg as Price looks to cut off room. This time Taibu gets there.
and another. This is disaster for Zimbabwe.
shoves this in full on the blockhole, and Shafiq plays it onto the boot and into the off side. Pakistan have 50 before you could have said Ramees Raja Junior.
tossed up on the off stump, Hafeez pushes it softly into the covers for one.
this is not the usual parsimonious Price. Short ball on leg stump, and Shafiq lap-sweeps it into vacant real estate behind square.
another wide down the leg side. Takes the over's count to nine wide runs for the over, as Taibu misses and they pinch a single too.
Hafeez backs away a touch and guides a tight ball on the stumps into the off side for a single.
Price's over has finally ended. He lands another one full on middle stump, and it is tapped into the off side for a single.
and he starts in earnest, gentle away seamer back of a length outside off, and Hafeez feels for it without conviction.

Hafeez tries to do a Dilshan, but doesn't quite pull it off. He gets the front foot forward and looks to scoop a length ball over the keeper's head. It takes the outside edge and balloons over where the slips would have been.
hammered. Elton drops short now, he's even slower than Mpofu, so that's an even worse idea. Hafeez summons his inner Djokovic and thumps it cross-batted over mid-on. Go fetch.
fuller length aimed at the pads, it runs off Hafeez's legs to the leg side for a single.

majestic from Shafiq. Another dolly from Elton, listless, neutered short ball that comes along in slow motion. Shafiq is inside the line and climbs onto it with a violent lofted pull. It lands behind the ropes at backward square leg.
fullish ball on Shafiq's pads to end the over, he whips to deep midwicket for a single. Pakistan will be looking at 200 from here as the Powerplay draws to a close.
back of a length from Price on middle and leg, Shafiq tries to slap it away but can't connect well.
fuller ball outside off, he gets forward to guide it to cover point for one.
well bowled, follows him as Hafeez looks to back away and delivers it full on the toes, and he inner-edges the heave to the leg side for no runs.
Price is working to a plan - full on leg stump with short fine leg and deep square leg in place. The sweep fetches a single.

many a slip between cup and lip for Shafiq. He works a full ball to short fine-leg and sets off for a hesitant single. Hafeez wasn't too sure, and Shafiq decided to turn back. He would have been fine, if not for the fact that he slipped and fell as he tried to turn. Coventry throws down the stumps.
and Price welcomes him with a spitting ripper, the sort that made Price famous. Speared in on middle and leg and then devilish straightening, leaves Rameez groping for it.
short of a length outside off, Hafeez just looked lazy as he tried to steer it and was beaten by the bounce.
fuller on off stump, Hafeez leans out to push it into the covers. No single to be taken.
he perfects the lap shot this time. Hamilton landed this well outside off, and Hafeez reaches across to redirect it over, and to the left of short fine leg for four.
fuller length again, Hafeez leans out to drive to cover.
this is like digging your own grave and going and lying in it. Hamilton waddles in and wafts a length ball on the pads at an amiable pace. Hafeez sends it into outer pace, almost.
over-pitched outside off to end the over, Hafeez clunks it to deep cover for one more.
starts with another paceless length ball outside off. Hafeez picks up another single into the covers.
Rameez is away, dabbing a short ball outside off to third man.
half-volley outside off to Hafeez, guided into the covers again
shortens the length to Rameez who meets it as he pushes forward and defends to the off side.
back of a length and angling in, Rameez turns the face too early and it pops off off the pad to the off side.
another short ball, Hafeez doesn't manage to quite savage it this time, and gets only a single.
Elton gets the wide bug now and slants one miles down the leg side.
over-pitched now, and sprayed wide on the other side. Hafeez square-drives for two more.
gets the line right this time, that is a start. Angling in from outside off, keeps Hafeez down to a check-drive to mid-on for one.
short of a length outside Rameez's off stump, and he guides it towards third man for a single.
attempts the yorker, angled in sharply at the toes, and Hafeez squeezes it out to the leg side for a single.
Rameez has had enough of the dabbed singles, he walks across the stumps and looks to punch a short ball into orbit, but he misses the short ball.
back of the hand slower ball that angles in towards the toes. Rameez takes it on the full and whips to deep midwicket for a single.

things not going Zim's way here, but they aren't helping their cause really. Half-volley on the pads at pop-gun pace, Rameez walks inside the line and hoicks it just wide of the man at deep square leg.
slower ball from Chamu, stops on Rameez and goes away, he carefully defends after thinking of something cheekier.
back of the hand again, very full on the toes, and Rameez flicks for a single,
slower ball again, dropped short but outside off, and Hafeez drags the pull all the way across to the man at deep midwicket.
ah. You thought Zim couldn't commit any more mistakes today. Think again. Chamu over-steps. Full ball outside off, driven to long-off for one.
caught in the deep by Cephas, who is denied a debut catch since it is a free-hit. Another smart slower ball, Hafeez couldn't time the lofted on-drive and picked out long-on.
finishes with a length ball on off stump which Rameez takes for a single into the covers.
back of a length outside off, Rameez angles it to the man at short third man.

Zimbabwe's nightmare is getting worse. Their fielding has been deplorable all series, and it is getting worse. Short ball from Hamilton, but not nearly short enough for the lofted pull. Hafeez did his best to scoop it up, but it was going straight down Mpofu's throat at deep midwicket. He seemed to come in too far and then tried to pouch it Aussie style over his head. No luck, he ends up parrying it over the ropes. Would not have been a 6 if he wasn't there.
inch-perfect yorker from Hamilton, and Hafeez in the form of his life can't get it away.
slow legcutter, Hafeez spots it late and taps into the off side for a single.

can someone teach these Zimbabweans out-fielding please! Jarvis does a Mpofu now, he charges in needless, gets too far in to take the catch and then dives ungainly to his right in a last-ditch effort to take it one-handed. The ball eludes him and rolls away for four.
if Hamilton is flustered by the drops he isn't showing it. Another decent length ball outside off, Rameez can't get it away.

and starts with a short ball on leg stump that Hafeez flaps over square leg with the freedom of a man who almost knows he can't be caught. And he's right. It doesn't carry to the man prowling in the deep.
Price is a generous, broad-minded man today. Or rather, a wide-minded man. Lands this at least two feet outside leg, and Taibu can't stop it.
he's trying to cut out all room by landing it on leg stump, when he gets it right there's little they can do. Like this ball.
another wide down the leg side. Rinse, repeat.

Sibanda at long-on does his best to leap up and haul it in, but this is not a day for Zimbabweans holding catches. Hafeez dances out to the length and mauls Price over long-on. Just enough to elude the fielder.
too short, Hafeez pulls to deep midwicket for two more. Pakistan are motoring along.
full ball on off stump, turned away to the leg side for a single.
over-pitched outside off, this is becoming easier than a net for Hafeez, who drives through extra-cover for two more. Chamu's misfield at deep extra cover didn't help matters.
over-pitched again, Hafeez eases into a square drive and gets one more.
full-length ball on middle and leg, Rameez mistimes a bottom-handed loft over the bowler's head.
good delivery, yorker on leg stump, Hafeez tries to jam down on it, and it goes off the pad to the leg side.
full toss on off stump for Rameez to guide into the covers for one more.
Zimbabwe's attack today is an embarrassment to the word attack. Full toss on the pads, Hafeez could have played that anywhere through the leg side, and he chose square leg.
full ball from Chamu on the stumps, Rameez mows it through mid-on for a single. Not too well timed.
legcutter on off stump now, Hafeez drops it towards point for a single.

ha! The bowling is so slow that Rameez walked across to off stump, set himself up for the paddle, and then realised he had time to kill. He ends up missing the lap and it runs off the pad to the off side for a single.
full toss on off stump, Hafeez drills it back past the bowler and Chigumbura at long-off does well to save a few.
full and straight at the stumps, Rameez drags it to the leg side for a single.

I am going to shock you all with news that Zimbabwe have held a catch in the deep. No kidding. Hafeez gets a low full toss on the pads and tries to cross-bat it over midwicket, but he picked out Charles Coventry in the deep. He looked pleasantly surprised after catching it.
pacier than any of his colleagues, full on the pads ans worked through square leg.
shortens the length this time, cramps the batsman for room as he looks to back away. Defended down the track in the end.

dropped again. Taibu leaps away to his right like a rampant salmon and tries to haul the fine edge from Umar, but he can't hold on. Really tough take, the shot was played late too, giving him very little time.
over-pitched on the pads, Rameez clips it comprehensively for a couple.
good yorker, and Rameez does well to crouch and deflect it, but he picks out short third man.
one of the better overs we have seen today. Jarvis keeps it full and straight, Rameez does his best to get muscle behind it, but times it weakly towards square leg for one.
Price fires it in short and straight, Rameez is late on the pull and drags it away towards long-on for one.
short of a length again, Umar can't launch it and ends up forcing a single into the covers.
Rameez is struggling. Another short and pacy ball, he is late on the pull and the ball dribbles back to the bowler.

probably unfair to the youngster, but I reckon Pakistan won't mind his wicket. Full, flat and straight from Price, it was a dart aimed at middle and leg. Rameez put down the right knee and tried to pull it, but missed.
back of a length and stifling line around middle, Malik plays it back down the track.
he gets away now, single bunted to long-on. Price ends his spell.

drops a return catch. Fulltoss on off stump to start the spell, caught Malik by surprise. It was such a harmless ball. He just popped it back to Mpofu's left as he went down on his follow through, but couldn't pouch it.
Umar walks across the stumps and laps Mpofu's listless full toss past short fine leg. Hideous bowling.
and now hideous fielding. Coventry at point doesn't account for the spin on the cut shot and misses a regulation save. Four more.
another length ball. Umar gets under it and hoicks it over midwicket. Not timed as well as he would have wanted, but gets two more.
length, length, length. Umar saunters out of the crease, gets under it and scoops it back down the ground over Mpofu's head for four more.
short ball to end the over, Umar moved too far across to make contact with it.
keeps it outside off on a length, Malik goes down kn a knee and plays the steer, but finds short third man.
too wide outside off, a befuddling line given that the cordon on the off side is inside the circle. Umar meanders across and scythes it up and over point's head.
low full toss, not a bad option in the circumstances. Umar tries to open up his stance and flay it, but ends up toe-ending to long on.

this is a Zimbabwean horror show on the field. Yorker outside off, Malik forces it straight to Hamilton at deep cover who does some sort of a juggling dance around the ball, allowing a second. And nearly a third too. He doesn't have the conviction to throw it in.
angles in on a length, Malik drags it away to wide long-on for two.
Zimbabwe hold another outfield catch. Length ball outside off, Malik tries to carve it inside out, but picks out Hamilton at deep cover.

this is more tragedy than comedy now. Tanvir gets under a length ball and launches it high towards long on. Vusi Sibanda was around three yards in when he caught it, but kept back-pedalling like a zombie. He inevitably reached the rope, noticed he was teetering over, and dropped the ball into play as he fell over.
wallop. Short of a length dolly from Mpofu whose biggest weapon as a bowler today has been hope. Tanvir clatters it over midwicket.
goes wide of off stump this time, Tanvir squeezes it away through third man for a couple. A fine fifty from Mpofu.
take that. And that. And now this. Length ball. Big bat swing. Cross-batted clatter. Bye bye, cricket ball. Get ready for landing.
finally gets a semblance of a yorker in, Tanvir shuffles away and forces it into the covers for one.

finishes with two good balls does Mpofu, but he bowled 22 forgettable ones before that. Full ball on the stumps, Umar gets it away into the covers for one, and Pak finish 2 short of 200. Mpofu has matched his worst T20 figures - 1-59 in Kimberley v SA.
